alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 05 at 3:49AM PST until March 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...The Winter Storm Warning is for areas above 1500 feet, and the Interstate 5 passes north of Grants Pass. The Winter Weather Advisory includes the Rogue and Applegate Valleys, including Grants Pass, Merlin, and Wilderville, and the Illinois Valley from Hayes Hill south to the State Line, including Selma, Cave Junction, Obrien. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Expect difficult travel conditions. Travel could be very difficult to impossible in the warning area. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will lower to about 500 feet during the early morning hours, then rise to around 1500 feet in the afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring, and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
